reviews.text: OMG! This station is epic. Generously sized platforms that feel pleasant underfoot. No visit to Tipton is complete without spending time here. Fortunately I just missed my train so was able to enjoy 26 minutes here, punctuated only by a man shouting. Be sure to check the tunnel under the track - legendary!
Small Train Station with limited services. Okay for links to Birmingham. It's Unstaffed most of the time though and the ticket machines don't work properly when it rains

Does the job intended with links to both Wolverhampton and Birmingham. 

Not usual staffed but on the Birmingham track there is a ticket machine.

Dirty place. Felt intimidated using this station. Got accosted and insulted by four youths. They four young people thought it was funny to dangle their legs over the tracks before oncoming trains. 

Not even a ticket office to buy a ticket for my journey. 

This place is horrible to wait xx

Does a good enough job of it's intended purpose - to get you as far away from Tipton as possible!

On a serious note, it's staffed a lot of the time and has decent connections to Birmingham and Wolverhampton, albeit at a 30 minute frequency with a few extra long distance trains stopping later on in the evening. It's usually kept clean and is located in a convenient place, however the ticket office is often closed so you end up having to walk to the other side of the station just to use a ticket machine. It's also served frequently by local buses to and from Dudley and West Bromwich, on the 42 route.
